title: Coronation Street: Kel Hinchley to LEAVE after abuse storyline
text:
Coronation Street star Joseph Alessi has revealed that his character Kel Hinchley will exit the Street after his historical abuse of Paul Foreman is exposed.

Speaking on Friday's Lorraine, the actor said his role on the soap is 'finite' as it's unlikely Kel would be welcomed back to the Weatherfield when his grooming of Paul as a child is revealed.

Kel arrived on the Street as Gemma and Paul's mum Bernie's ex-boyfriend, but his sinister past has since been exposed as the soap tackles the issue of historic sexual abuse.

Dark: Coronation Street star Joseph Alessi told Lorraine on Friday that his character Kel Hinchley will exit the Street after his historical abuse of Paul Foreman is exposed

When asked whether he knows how long he'll be staying on the Street, Joseph told Lorraine: 'I have no idea, it's open ended. I'll never be a regular due to the character I'm playing. But there's going to be a lot of fall out first.'

Kel made a surprise arrival on the Street last month when it was revealed he and Bernie had rekindled their romance.

While a pregnant Gemma (played by Dolly-Rose Campbell) was delighted by the news, Paul (Peter Ash) couldn't hide his upset, and soon admitted to boyfriend Billy Mayhew that Kel sexually abused him as a child.

Horrific: The ITV soap is tackling the issue of historical sexual abuse, as it was revealed that Kel groomed stepson Paul Foreman as a child (pictured in the soap)

Dark: Joseph revealed that he did feel some pressure in taking on such a dark role, and also admitted he's no stranger to playing the soap villain

In heartbreaking scenes Paul broke down in tears as Billy vowed to support him if he decided to go to the authorities.

Joseph told Lorraine that he felt a small amount of pressure in playing such a villainous character, saying: 'It’s important to get this across that they appear to be normal people, they're not monsters.

'I phoned my mum. She told half the town. She told me she couldn't believe I was playing such a bad man.'

Explosive: Fans have recently seen Paul finally reveal the truth about his abuse, and soap bosses have confirmed that he will seek justice for Kel's crimes

The actor also said that he hopes the storyline will help encourage other victims of sexual abuse to come forward, adding: 'It shows the importance of shows like Corrie, like David's rape storyline it increased calls to the helpline massively.

'It encourages people, especially working class men who are too afraid to speak out.'

Fans will have to wait and see when Paul finally decides to contact the authorities, but soap bosses have confirmed that he will seek justice for Kel's crime.

It is currently unclear when he will decide to tell his family about his ordeal, as Kel is currently playing the victim card after Paul lashed out and attacked him.

If you've been affected by the issues raised on the show, call Victim Support on 0333 300 6389.

Coronation Street airs on Friday at 7:30pm and 8:30pm on ITV. Lorraine airs weekdays at 8:30am on ITV.
